title: 109_hr4112
content: The Act is known as the "National Emergency Centers Establishment Act" and it establishes National Emergency Centers. The National Emergency Centers Establishment Act mandates the establishment of at least 6 national emergency centers on military installations. These centers will provide temporary housing, medical assistance, training for first responders, coordination of preparedness efforts, and other necessary services during emergencies or disasters. The National Emergency Centers Establishment Act mandates the establishment of at least 6 national emergency centers on military installations to provide temporary housing, medical assistance, training for first responders, coordination of preparedness efforts, and other necessary services during emergencies or disasters, as determined by the Secretary of Homeland Security. The National Emergency Centers Establishment Act mandates the designation of military installations as national emergency centers. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, must designate at least 6 military installations as national emergency centers within 60 days of the Act's enactment. These centers must meet various requirements to accommodate individuals affected by emergencies or disasters, ensure environmental safety, conduct drills and operations, and be easily accessible at all times. The National Emergency Centers must be established in specific areas based on FEMA regions. Preference is given to closed military installations for designation as emergency centers. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, designates closed military installations or portions of existing military installations as national emergency centers. The Secretary of Defense transfers administrative jurisdiction to the Secretary of Homeland Security for closed military installations designated as national emergency centers. The Secretary of Homeland Security and the Secretary of Defense must enter into a cooperative agreement for the establishment of a national emergency center within 180 days of designation. A preliminary report outlining site selection reasons and construction needs must be submitted to Congress within 90 days of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Homeland Security and Defense must enter into a cooperative agreement for a national emergency center within 180 days. A report outlining site selection reasons, infrastructure needs, environmental clean-up, transfer of control, and cooperative agreement plans must be submitted to Congress within 120 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense, must provide Congress with a report on designated sites, including updates, progress towards transferring control, establishing a national emergency center, and recommendations for necessary authorizations and appropriations. The Secretary of Homeland Security, along with the Secretary of Defense, must submit a final report to Congress within one year of the enactment of the Act. The report should include details on the transfer of control, cooperative agreements, and any other relevant information for the establishment of a national emergency center at designated sites. Additional reports may also be required by the Secretary of Homeland Security. The Secretary of Homeland Security, with the Secretary of Defense, may submit additional reports to Congress as needed to update on meeting the Act's requirements. SEC. 4. LIMITATIONS ON STATUTORY CONSTRUCTION. This Act does not affect the authority of the Federal Government to provide emergency or disaster assistance, or the authority of State or local governments to respond to emergencies. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. $125,000,000 is authorized for each of fiscal years 2006 and 2007 to carry out this Act. Such funds shall remain available until expended. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions include closed military installation, emergency, major disaster, and military installation. The term "installation" is defined in section 2910 of the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990.
